name: A Canvas & Bear Paint Pouring Workshop
description:
Play with colours and patterns with this satisfying art technique. Let loose and express yourself in a fun and fluid way. Embrace the unpredictable patterns to create a one of a kind piece of art. No experience needed.

Please see more Paint Pouring Workshops on our website.

name: Wildlife Walk
description:
Join Dr. Laura McKinnon, from York University, for an engaging outdoor exploration of the fascinating research happening at the Park. From observing birds like Killdeers and Robins to uncovering the hidden world of Crayfish in our waters, this guided walk will provide unique insights into local wildlife and conservation efforts. Be prepared for an immersive experience in nature, so comfortable walking shoes are highly recommended!

Pets are not permitted at this program. Service animals are always welcome.

French language service is available upon request. Please let us know.

name: John Tabor Park Tree Planting Event

address.streetAddress: John Tabor Park, 240 John Tabor Trail

description:
Contribute to enhancing John Tabor Park’s biodiversity and wildlife habitat by planting native trees and shrubs!

Event site conditions vary. Contact us for more information including accessibility. If you would like to request accessibility support, contact us as soon as possible.

name: What We Saw - Photography Group Exhibition During Contact
description: Under the umbrella of What We Saw, eight visual artists present unique perspectives on themes of place, identity and society. Their works consist of both digital and analog photographs and their images range from straight photography to blur and abstraction.

name: A Custom Tote Bag Workshop
description:
Design your own custom tote bag in this playful, hands-on workshop! Choose to paint directly or create a digital collage to heat press onto your bag—we provide the tools, guidance, and plenty of room for creative freedom.

Please see more Paint Workshops here: https://www.artboxstudiogallery.com/paint-workshops

name: Bollywood Dance Class @ Soulpepper Theatre

location.name: Young Centre for the Performing Arts

description: Join instructor Nidhi Baadkar for a free Bollywood Dance workshop! This class is designed for both beginners and people with a range of experience.

name: Vocal Workshop with César Alejandro Carrillo
description:
Visionary Venezuelan composer and choral conductor César Alejandro Carrillo, internationally recognized for his emotionally rich compositions and masterful arrangements, gives a workshop for the Upper Canada Choristers, Cantemos Latin ensemble, and anyone else interested in choral singing. 

Topics include vocal production, an introduction to Venezuelan choral music, and a workshop on two movements of Carrillo’s Missa Sine Nomine.  Price includes a ticket to the Upper Canada Choristers’ May 16 performance, Venezuela Viva.

name: Campus Secrets and Spectres – University of Toronto Ghost Tour

location.name: The sidewalk in front of the Royal Conservatory of Music

description: Explore the majestic gothic architecture and picturesque tree-lined paths of the campus as we uncover its eerie history and spine-chilling ghostly tales. As we stroll through the historic grounds, our expert guides will captivate you with chilling stories of ghostly sightings and supernatural phenomena witnessed by students, faculty, and visitors alike. Whether you’re a history buff, a believer in the paranormal, a student or alum, or just looking for a unique and spooky evening experience in Toronto, our Campus Secrets & Spectres ghost tour will leave you with a sense of wonder and intrigue as we reveal the haunted secrets of the University of Toronto’s downtown campus.

name: Wednesday Night Dinner Folk Americana Bluegrass with Robert Thomas & The Sessionmen
description: 2025 International Acoustic Music Award Winner Robert Thomas has crafted songs for legends including, Kenny Rogers, Bonnie Raitt, Joe Cocker and the Dixie Chicks. Accompanied on fiddle, mandolin, guitar, keyboards and percussion by the legendary “sessionmen” - Ray Legere and Jon Arsenault - whose credits in their own right include, Alison Krauss, Rita MacNeil, Doc Watson, Tony Rice and The Chieftains - Thomas delivers beautiful and energetic Folk/Americana mixed with a touch of Bluegrass that has captivated audiences across North America and Europe, and garnered Entertainer of the Year and multiple songwriter nominations from the East Coast Music Association.

name: Second Harvest Truck Pull Challenge

address.streetAddress: Toronto City Hall, 100 Queen St W

description:
This exciting Challenge tests your strength and teamwork! Teams of 10 compete in a tournament to pull a 20,000-pound truck across Nathan Phillips Square, raising funds for Second Harvest’s food rescue efforts.

Open to corporate teams and the public, this year introduces individual registration—join a team of like-minded people making a difference!

Every $1 raised provides three meals for those in need. By participating, you’ll help provide 750 meals.

Join the fun, challenge yourself, and support a great cause!
